title: Chinese Laundry Blues
lyrics:
(D7) Now Mr. (G) Wu was a (Eb7) laundry man
In a (G) shop with an (D7) old green (G) door
He’d (D7) iron all day your (G) linen away
He (A7) really makes me (D7) sore
He’s (Am) lost his (D7) heart to a (Am) Chinese (D7) girl
And his (G) laundry’s all (Cm) gone (G) wrong
All (A7) day he’ll flirt and scorch your shirt
That’s why I’m singing this (D7) song
 
(D7) Oh Mr. (G) Wu, what can I (E7) do,
I'm feeling (A7) kind of Limehouse
(Eb7) Chinese (D7) laundry (G) blues (G7)
This funny (C) feeling, keeps (Cm) round me (G) stealing (E7)
Oh (A7) wont you throw your sweat-heart over (D) do (Bm) (D7)
My vests so (G) short that it wont fit (G7) my little brother
And my (C) new Sunday shirt has got a (Eb7) perforated rudder
Mr. (G) Wu (B7) what shall I (E7) do, I’m feeling (A7) kind of Limehouse
(Eb7) Chinese (D7) laundry (G) blues
 
(D7) Now Mr. (G) Wu, he’s got a (G7) naughty eye that flickers
You (C) ought to see it wobble
When he’s (Eb7) ironing ladies blouses!
Mr. (G) Wu (B7) what shall I (E7) do, I’m feeling (A7) kind of Limehouse
(Eb7) Chinese (D7) laundry (G) blues
(D7) Now Mr. (G) Wu he’s got a (G7) laundry kind of tricky
Hell (C) starch my shirt and collars
But he’ll (Eb7) never touch my waistcoat!
Mr. (G) Wu (B7) what shall I (E7) do, I’m feeling (A7) kind of Limehouse
(Eb7) Chinese (D7) laundry (G) blues
 
(D7) Oh Mr. (G) Wu, what can I (E7) do, I’m feeling (A7) kind of Limehouse
(Eb7) Chinese (D7) laundry (G) blues (G7)
This funny (C) feeling, keeps (Cm) round me (G) stealing (E7)
Oh (A7) wont you throw your sweat-heart over (D) do (Bm) (D7)
My vests so (G) short that it wont fit (G7) my little brother
And my (C) new Sunday shirt has got a (Eb7) perforated rudder
 
Mr. (G) Wu (B7) what shall I (E7) do, I’m feeling (A7) kind of Limehouse
(Eb7) Chinese (D7) laundry (G) blues [end]
